results.title: Sovereign Hill: goldmining township, Ballarat
results.brief_description: A look at Sovereign Hill- a reconstructed goldmining town in Ballarat. Shows not only the buildings and the implements but also shows how the people lived.
results.description: A look at Sovereign Hill- a reconstructed goldmining town in Ballarat. Shows not only the buildings and the implements but also shows how the people lived.

results.title: Sovereign hill
results.creator_credit: Peter Dodds, Penny Spence and Nine Network
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Sovereign Hill, Ballarat, this Australian documentary recreates the nineteenth century to explain the historical events surrounding gold discovery in Australia. Produced with the assistance of the Management and Friends of Sovereign Hill Gold Mining Township. A study guide accompanies the video.

results.title: Souvenirs, Souvenirs = Memories, Memories
results.brief_description:
Paris, 1962. Rego Boccara is back from a tour of duty in Algeria and attempts to revive his singing career. His agent, Nadia, must help him fight the animosity of Firmani, an influent music-hall owner, who has vowed never to allow Rego back on stage. Meanwhile, Antoine, Rego’s younger brother, is marking time at the local high school, until the day he meets the new music teacher. This ‘coming of age’ drama is a faithful portraiture of France and its youth culture in the early 1960s. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (Cesar) 1985: Best Promising Young Actor for Pierre-Loup Rajot.

Credits: Producer, Ariel Zeitoun ; director, Ariel Zeitoun ; writer, Daniel Saint-Hamont, Ariel Zeitoun ; photography, Bruno de Keyzer ; music, Cyril Assous, Jean-Paul Dreau ; assistant director, Regis Wargnier.
Cast: Christophe Malavoy, Pierre-Loup Rajot, Claude Brasseur, Annie Girardot, Marlene Jobert, Philippe Noiret, Jean Benguigui.

results.title: Souvenirs from Sweden
results.creator_credit: Henning Carlsen, Svenska filminstitutet and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: An unconventional picture of modern Sweden, its people and its natural beauty. Sailing in the archipelago, glass-blowing at Orrefors, the Vasa skiing race, the Nobel Festival - the everyday life of Swedes and their special occasions. (Awards: Grand Prize of the Annual International Travel Film Festival)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henning Carlsen, Svenska filminstitutet and Svensk Filmindustri

results.title: Souvenirs D'en France = Insider Memories of France
results.brief_description:
Pedret, a Spanish migrant, has built a prosperous business in which his three sons, Prosper, Hector, Victor are employed. Prosper has married a girl from the local bourgeoisie who has no interest in the factory and its problems. Hector is married to Berthe, a former laundress, whose strength of character and drive attracts the support of Pedret. He supports her in her attempts to bring in a few changes in the factory management. When WWII breaks out, Berthe refuses to imitate her family who retreats in passive neutrality and becomes heavily involved in the Resistance. Techine’s film explores the relation between history and ‘personal histories’ (the title contains a pun on ‘en France’ and ‘enfance’, childhood), focusing on a family from the 1930s to the 1970s. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (1975): Best Supporting Actress for Marie-France Pisier.

Credits: Producer, Vera Belmont ; director, Andre Techine ; writers, Andre Techine, Marylin Goldin ; photography, Bruno Nuytten ; music, Philippe Sarde.
Cast: Jeanne Moreau, Michel Auclair, Marie-France Pisier, Claude Mann, Orane Demazis.

results.title: Southward ho!: in New Zealand's beautiful South Island
results.brief_description: A travelogue of the South Island showing Queen Charlotte Sound, fishing and picnics, Nelson City and car services to west coast, lakes, glaciers, ferns, Franz Josef Glacier, Christchurch, River Avon, Canterbury College, Lyttleton (port of Christchurch and southern terminus for express steamer service) and much more.
